thread.title: You can now get married at Taco Bell, thank goodness (5 Photos)
thread.title_full: You can now get married at Taco Bell, thank goodness (5 Photos)

author: Shelbie
title: You can now get married at Taco Bell, thank goodness (5 Photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
If you’d prefer your wedding bells to come with a prefix of taco, this contest is for you. The Love and Tacos Contest has engaged couples all over the country entering to win an all-expense paid trip to Las Vegas to get married. However the wedding won’t be the standard little white chapel affair that happens daily in Sin City. The lucky bride and groom will be the first-ever couple to tie the knot in the Las Vegas Cantina flagship Taco Bell restaurant. 2 
If you dream of your big day and see visions of Doritos Locos tacos dancing in your head, all you have to do is tell your love story through a short video between now and March 1st. If you win, here’s what you’ll get: 
-Airfare for six to Las Vegas -A Taco Bell catered dinner at the Las Vegas restaurant -Taco Bell wedding shirts, champagne flutes, garter and bow tie -Professional photography/videography -A room at the Planet Hollywood Hotel -Two tickets for the high roller at the LINQ -A private pool cabana at the Planet Hollywood hotel pool -VIP table for six at Drai’s Nightclub -Entry for two and $100 credit at Qua Baths and Spa 3 
Many people have gotten creative throughout the years with Taco Bell at their weddings, but this is the first time a wedding is officially made to order. 
Chief Marketing Officer of Taco Bell Corp. Marisa Thalberg says, “Now, through our new flagship restaurant on the Las Vegas Strip, couples can come right in and order a wedding off of our menu.” 4 
Yep, you heard that right. You’ll still have a chance to say your vows in the presence of fast food greatness even if you don’t win, because as of summer 2017, you can spend $600 for the wedding package of your cheesy dreams. 5 
The package will include: -A ceremony in the chapel inside the restaurant with an ordained officiant within as little as four hours -Private area for a reception inside the restaurant with up to 15 of your closest family and friends -Custom merchandise, including a sauce packet garter and bow tie, “Just Married” T-shirts for the bride and groom, Taco Bell branded champagne flutes and, of course, a Taco 12 Pack filled with tacos and a Cinnabon Delights cake for dessert -A Sauce Packet bouquet for the bride to use during the ceremony 
Nothing says “I love you” like nachos supreme for two, am I right? 
Related Video: Two girls throw fists while guy calmly orders at Taco Bell Advertisement
